question: Which among the following temperature scale is based upon absolute zero?
explanation: Kelvin is the base unit of temperature (SI unit), having the unit symbol K. The Kelvin temperature scale has an absolute zero (0째K) below which temperatures do not exist. It is the lowest possible temperature. At this temperature there is no motion and no heat. It is equivalent to 0째K, or -273.15째 C, or at -460째 F.
